name: Bizarre American Laws - Real And Fake Trivia Game | World | 10 Questions

questions.text: Allegedly, the Encyclopedia Britannica is banned in Texas because it contains instructions on how to make what?
questions.explanation:
Beer.

	This one is fake - there never was such a law.

questions.text: In Florida, it is illegal to sing in public while attired in a what?
questions.explanation:
Swimsuit.

	This one seems to be true.

questions.text: Allegedly, in Iowa what type of piano players must perform for free?
questions.explanation:
One-armed piano players.

	This is often cited as true, but no-one has ever found a copy of an actual legal document stating this.

questions.text: In Wyoming, it is sometimes claimed that you cannot take a picture of which animal during the months of January to April?
questions.explanation:
Rabbit.

	This is not strictly true, although there was once a law prohibiting photographing any "game animal" during these months, presumably to prevent disturbing them during the breeding season.

questions.text: In Tennessee, what is the only type of game you can shoot from a moving vehicle?
questions.explanation:
Whale.

	This one is a fake.

questions.text: In Lexington Kentucky, it is illegal to transport an ice cream where?
questions.explanation:
In your pocket.

	This does seem to have been a local bye-law in the 1800s.

questions.text: In Rhode Island, it is considered offensive to throw what kind of juice on a trolley?
In Wilbur, Washington, you may not ride what kind of horse?
questions.explanation:
Ugly.

	I wonder what constitutes an ugly horse.

questions.text: In Michigan, it was at one time against the law to do this in front of women and children?
In Cleveland, Ohio, it is illegal to catch what without a hunting license?
